intro: Tococa macedoi, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are edible but often have a spicy or peppery taste. Tococa macedoi is adapted to warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal regions and lowland forests. Its aromatic leaves and ornamental value make it a popular plant in horticulture, although it can be invasive in some areas.
